resources.string: While owning a single-family home will mean total independence, there are a few factors that can be seen as downsides. Condos, townhouses, or multifamily properties may come with common gyms or pools open to all owners; single-family homes do not usually have community amenities. The purchase price of a single-family home tends to be higher, since you are buying an entire lot, says Papoutsakis. That translates into a larger down payment and closing costs as well as recurring expenses like insurance and property taxes.Multifamily residences normally have an R2 rating, which means two residential dwellings can exist on the property, typically in the form of a duplex. And an R3 rating permits multifamily units such as apartments or condominiums.
